head.title: In New Jersey, Corzine or Franks?

hedline.hl1: In New Jersey, Corzine or Franks?

abstract.p: Samuel del Propost letter disputes Oct 25 editorial endorsing Repr Bob Franks over Jon S Corzine for US Senate seat from New Jersey

block.p: In endorsing Bob Franks, the Republican, over Jon S. Corzine, the Democrat, for United States senator from New Jersey (editorial, Oct. 25), you have your priorities backward.
In endorsing Bob Franks, the Republican, over Jon S. Corzine, the Democrat, for United States senator from New Jersey (editorial, Oct. 25), you have your priorities backward.

Campaign financing is the sidebar. It is myopic and unfair to penalize Mr. Corzine for playing by the campaign rules as they now exist, especially when the stakes are so high. Instead, the focus should be on the candidates' stands on the issues.

It is unconscionable to embrace a candidate whose positions and record are inconsistent at best and generally not in the best interests of most New Jerseyans simply because the other candidate has spent the resources needed to get his message across.
Mr. Corzine is to be commended for the courage he has shown in the positions he has taken and for the commitment he is making.
SAMUEL DEL PROPOST Maplewood, N.J., Oct. 25, 2000
